column5: I finally got around to writing up my summer report. We had an awesome trip and would recommend it to anyone for a good holiday. Here is the link to it on another site as i'm not sure how to rewrite it here and add all the pics in it. http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...owl-lake-2016/ Thanks for reading Mike

Thanks for the report! I can commiserate with wind issues; nothing worse than being stuck on shore due to strong winds. In the course of a week, it seems that being windbound at least one day is the norm. I can fish in just about any conditions, but I am very cautious about exposure to high winds in an outpost boat.
Growing up fishing on Lake Erie I quickly learned to respect the wind.
